lead_paragraph: 7:53 p.m. | Updated David Jolly at The New York Times has more.
snippet: Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria, the second-largest Spanish lender after Santander, said Tuesday that it would buy nearly a quarter of the Turkish bank Garanti for 4.2 billion euros, and raise 5 billion euros with a rights issue to finance the deal.

headline.main: B.B.V.A. to Take $5.9 Billion Stake in Turkish Bank

abstract: Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria, the second-largest Spanish lender after Santander, said Tuesday that it would buy nearly a quarter of the Turkish bank Garanti for 4.2 billion euros, and raise 5 billion euros with a rights issue to finance the deal.
